Package ch.nolix.core.invalidArgumentException

Class InvalidArgumentException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • ch.nolix.core.invalidArgumentException.InvalidArgumentException
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BiggerArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException, EqualArgumentException, FalseArgumentException, InRangeArgumentException, NegativeArgumentException, NonBiggerArgumentException, NonEmptyArgumentException, NonNegativeArgumentException, NonPositiveArgumentException, NonRepresentingArgumentException, NonSmallerArgumentException, NotNullArgumentException, NullArgumentException, OutOfRangeArgumentException, PositiveArgumentException, SmallerArgumentException, TrueArgumentException, UnequalArgumentException, ZeroArgumentException

    public class InvalidArgumentException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    An invalid invalid argument exception is a runtime exception that is intended to be thrown when an argument is not valid or has a undesired property. An invalid invalid argument exception stores always the argument name of the argument it is created for. An invalid invalid argument exception can store optionally the argument it is created for.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Creates new invalid argument exception for the given argument with the given argument name and the given error predicate.
      InvalidArgumentException​(ArgumentName argumentName, ErrorPredicate errorPredicate)
      Creates new invalid argument exception for an argument with the given argument name and the given error predicate.
      InvalidArgumentException​(Argument argument, ErrorPredicate errorPredicate)
      Creates new invalid argument exception for the given argument and the given error predicate.
      InvalidArgumentException​(ErrorPredicate errorPredicate)
      Creates new invalid argument exception for an argument with a default argument name and for the given error predicate.
